quest.name: Tikka Hike
journal:
 Quest Sync
The child is looking around, trying to catch the attention of any passersby.
objectives: Speak with the auburn-haired Au Ra.
Lie in wait and slay the sotormurg when it appears.
Deliver the sotormurg meat to the auburn-haired Au Ra.
Speak with the auburn-haired Au Ra at Yedlihmad.

dialogue.name: CHILDA04198
dialogue.text: Oh, you look fierce! Are you? Can you help me find my sister?

dialogue.name: CHILDA04198
dialogue.text: She went off to hunt sotormurg so she could make me chicken tikka. She's so brave, but she's been gone for quite some time...

dialogue.name: CHILDA04198
dialogue.text: I've never strayed far from the gates, and those beasts look so frightening. She shouldn't be far─can you find her for me?

dialogue.name: CHILDA04198
dialogue.text: She has red hair, and she looks so elegant in her hunting garb. She set off to the northwest─I'll be waiting here for you to come back!

dialogue.name: CHILDA04198
dialogue.text: She set off to the northwest, dressed in her breathtaking hunting garb. Oh, I do hope she's safe.

dialogue.name: CHILDB04198
dialogue.text: Quiet, you... I'm lying in wait, can't you see? What is it?

dialogue.name: CHILDB04198
dialogue.text: My sister? Oh, she does worry after me so. I apologize for her imposition.

dialogue.name: CHILDB04198
dialogue.text: Today is her nameday, and I wanted to do something special for her. So much has gone wrong as of late, and she's managed to always keep a smile on her face.

dialogue.name: CHILDB04198
dialogue.text: I thought that sotormurg would be simple prey, but now that I've seen one up close, I can barely bring myself to move. I've never been so afraid, truth be told...

dialogue.name: CHILDB04198
dialogue.text: But you...you look as if you've never known fear. You could make quick work of the sotormurg, I'm certain. If you don't mind...could you slay the animal for me? I've already set the traps, so one should be along soon enough.

dialogue.name: CHILDB04198
dialogue.text: Without their meat, I can't hope to make the chicken tikka that my sister so adores. Please, if not for me, then do it for her?

dialogue.name: CHILDB04198
dialogue.text: She's spoken of little else but chicken tikka as of late. Meat from the sotormurg would help make her dreams come true. Please, if you can spare a moment, one should be along soon.

dialogue.name: CHILDB04198
dialogue.text: That was an inspiring display! Were you able to procure its meat?

dialogue.name: CHILDB04198
dialogue.text: Ah, this is the most delicious part! Thank you, thank you!

dialogue.name: CHILDB04198
dialogue.text: You must let me repay you for your bravery. Please, meet me near the city gates, where I told my sister to wait. I do hope she hasn't wandered off.

dialogue.name: CHILDA04198
dialogue.text: Sister, you've returned!

dialogue.name: CHILDB04198
dialogue.text: There's the brave traveler!

dialogue.name: CHILDA04198
dialogue.text: Thank you for finding my sister! She said you took down that sotormurg in a single blow!

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Anything for chicken tikka.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: It is your nameday, after all.

dialogue.name: CHILDA04198
dialogue.text: Thank you!

dialogue.name: CHILDB04198
dialogue.text: The memories of us gathering around the table as a family over a homemade feast are among my fondest.

dialogue.name: CHILDB04198
dialogue.text: Our parents have gone to Radz–at–Han to find work, seeing as how there is none to be found here since that tower appeared. They've sent word they'll return for this little one's nameday.

dialogue.name: CHILDB04198
dialogue.text: I want them to arrive to a feast rivaling the ones from before. And thanks to you, they will. Please, take this for all you've done to give our family a memory we can cherish.
